intro: Verbascum linkianum, commonly known as the linkian mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are broad and velvety, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Verbascum linkianum is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
